summary: In Q4 2025, AMD reported record revenue of $9.2 billion, a 36% year-over-year increase, with net income rising 31% and free cash flow more than tripling. The data center segment drove growth, with revenue up 22% to $4.3 billion, primarily from strong sales of EPYC processors and Instinct GPUs. The client and gaming segment also performed well, with a 73% revenue increase to $4 billion, bolstered by robust demand for Ryzen processors. AMD anticipates continued strong demand in the data center AI market, with significant customer engagement for upcoming products, although risks include potential supply chain challenges and competitive pressures in the semiconductor industry. No explicit guidance changes were mentioned, but the tone suggests optimism about future growth driven by AI and cloud computing.
